newsitem.title: CHINA: Guangzhou foreign investment utilisation up.
newsitem.headline: Guangzhou foreign investment utilisation up.

text.p: Actual foreign investment utilised by Guangzhou, capital of China's southern Guangdong province, totalled $900 million in the first four months of 1997, the China News Service said on Monday.
The figure represented a 24 percent increase compared with the year-ago period, the agency said, quoting Vice-Mayor Chen Kaizhi.
The value of new contracted foreign investment in the first four months plunged 58 percent compared with the same 1996 period, it said. The figure fell 25 percent in 1996.
Guangzhou is expected to utilise actual foreign investment averaging $2.5 billion a year through 2000, the agency said.
